segment.source: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package
segment.target: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package

segment.source: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package
segment.target: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package

segment.source: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package
segment.target: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package

segment.source: The deployment package installation provides a method of installing MED-V client together with all its required prerequisites as well as any settings predefined by the administrator.
segment.target: The deployment package installation provides a method of installing MED-V client together with all its required prerequisites as well as any settings predefined by the administrator.

segment.source: When using a deployment package, the package is distributed via a shared network or removable media.
segment.target: When using a deployment package, the package is distributed via a shared network or removable media.

segment.source: The image can be included in the package or can be distributed separately.
segment.target: The image can be included in the package or can be distributed separately.

segment.source: Before creating a deployment package, ensure that you have created a MED-V image ready for deployment.
segment.target: Before creating a deployment package, ensure that you have created a MED-V image ready for deployment.

segment.source: For more information on creating a MED-V image, see Creating a MED-V Image.
segment.target: For more information on creating a MED-V image, see Creating a MED-V Image.

segment.source: After the MED-V image is prepared, consider the best method for distributing the image in your environment.
segment.target: After the MED-V image is prepared, consider the best method for distributing the image in your environment.

segment.source: The image can be distributed in one of the following ways:
segment.target: The image can be distributed in one of the following ways:

segment.source: Uploaded to the Web and distributed via Web download, optionally using Trim Transfer technology.
segment.target: Uploaded to the Web and distributed via Web download, optionally using Trim Transfer technology.

segment.source: Distributed using image pre-staging.
segment.target: Distributed using image pre-staging.

segment.source: Included in the deployment package and distributed together with all the other MED-V components.
segment.target: Included in the deployment package and distributed together with all the other MED-V components.

segment.source: If the image will be included in the package, no other configurations are necessary for the image.
segment.target: If the image will be included in the package, no other configurations are necessary for the image.

segment.source: If the image will not be included in the deployment package, do one of the following:
segment.target: If the image will not be included in the deployment package, do one of the following:

segment.source: If you are deploying the image via the Web, upload the MED-V image to the image Web distribution server.
segment.target: If you are deploying the image via the Web, upload the MED-V image to the image Web distribution server.

segment.source: For information on configuring an image Web distribution server, see How to Configure the Image Web Distribution Server.
segment.target: For information on configuring an image Web distribution server, see How to Configure the Image Web Distribution Server.

segment.source: For information on uploading an image to the server, see How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server.
segment.target: For information on uploading an image to the server, see How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server.

segment.source: If you are deploying the image via image pre-staging, configure the pre-stage folder, and push the MED-V image to the folder.
segment.target: If you are deploying the image via image pre-staging, configure the pre-stage folder, and push the MED-V image to the folder.

segment.source: For more information on configuring the image pre-staging, see How to Configure Image Pre-staging.
segment.target: For more information on configuring the image pre-staging, see How to Configure Image Pre-staging.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are using image pre-staging, it is important to configure the image pre-stage folder prior to creating the deployment package.
segment.target: If you are using image pre-staging, it is important to configure the image pre-stage folder prior to creating the deployment package.

segment.source: The folder path needs to be included in the deployment package.
segment.target: The folder path needs to be included in the deployment package.

segment.source: Finally, create the deployment package.
segment.target: Finally, create the deployment package.

segment.source: For more information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.
segment.target: For more information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.

segment.source: After the package is complete, distribute it for deployment.
segment.target: After the package is complete, distribute it for deployment.

segment.source: After the deployment package is distributed, MED-V client can be installed and the image deployed.
segment.target: After the deployment package is distributed, MED-V client can be installed and the image deployed.

segment.source: For more information on installing MED-V client, see How to Install MED-V Client.
segment.target: For more information on installing MED-V client, see How to Install MED-V Client.

segment.source: For more information on deploying the image, see How to Deploy a Workspace Image.
segment.target: For more information on deploying the image, see How to Deploy a Workspace Image.
